newsitem.title: USA: GE says not interested in American Express.
newsitem.headline: GE says not interested in American Express.

text.p: As rumors ran through the stock market about a possible deal between the two companies, General Electric Co reiterated on Thursday that it was not interested in buying American Express Co.
"We wouldn't talk about rumors," said a GE spokesman. "As we've been saying for many, many months, we are not interested in American Express."
American Express said it doesn't comment on market rumor and speculation.
Rumors again swept the market that American Express was in play, with GE as the latest dance partner.
"GE is the hottest rumor," said one trader. "Last week, it was Citicorp. This week, it's GE. It's hot and heavy this morning."
"Anytime you're talking about any financial (services) acquisition, GE's name will always be mentioned," said an arbitrageur.
On Tuesday, rumors were revived that Citicorp and American Express were talking about a deal. A Citicorp spokesman declined to comment on the matter.
Earlier this month, published reports said that American Express and Citicorp had held unsuccessful merger talks. The reports were never confirmed.
American Express shares fell 1-1/4 to 57-7/8, while GE gained 1-1/8 to 103-1/8. Citicorp rose 1-7/8 to 107-1/8.
